paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a novel mutation A78T in the KCNH2 gene associated with Long QT Syndrome Type 2 (LQT2) in a 7-year-old boy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: QT interval was 535 ms and QT interval corrected for heart rate was 496 ms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 7-year-old boy was diagnosed with LQT2. The QT interval was 535 ms and the QT interval corrected for heart rate was 496 ms.

functional_data.summary: The A78T-HERG protein showed reduced stability and failed to transfer to the plasma membrane, with significant ubiquitination and impaired maturation.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation was characterized by protein instability and reduced expression on the plasma membrane.
key_quotes: A78T-HERG was characterized by protein instability and reduced expression on the plasma membrane.
Direct sequencing of HERG (KCNH2) alleles identified the mutation G232A (A78T) in one allele.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information regarding the KCNH2 variant.
